thread.title: iCIMS Recognized for Exceptional Customer Service; Strong Leadership

author: cnbc.com
title: iCIMS Recognized for Exceptional Customer Service; Strong Leadership

organizations.name: stevie awards for sales & customer service

text:
Holmdel, NJ, April 02, 2018 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- iCIMS Inc. , a leading provider of cloud-based talent acquisition solutions , announced today that the company has received recognitions for excellence in three areas across customer service and leadership. The three accolades came from The Stevie Awards for Sales and Customer Service, ROI Influencers Power List for 2018 and the Department of Defense’s Employer Support of the Guard and Reserve.
Stevie Awards
iCIMS’ commitment to offering an exceptional customer experience has led to recognition by the Stevie Awards for Sales & Customer Service for the seventh consecutive year. The company was recognized in the customer service department of the year category among computer software companies with 100 or more employees. iCIMS was recognized for its customer service teams’ devotion to achieving growth and progress. Most notably, in 2017 the teams focused on making improvements to the areas of web support, call support, training and customer self-service initiatives.
“Not many companies can point to seven consecutive years of recognition for outstanding customer service,” said Adam Feigenbaum, iCIMS Chief Customer Officer. “These awards are important because they represent the sincere passion and dedication iCIMS employees put forth to drive positive outcomes for our customers.”
ROI Influencers
Colin Day, iCIMS CEO, was named to the inaugural ROI Influencers Power List for 2018 as one of the most influential people in New Jersey-based companies. Day was one of six in the state selected in the technology category including the CEOs and presidents of Audible, Bell Labs, Marketsmith Inc., NJ Tech Council and NJ Innovation Institute.
The top executives named to the list are devoted to their industry’s growth within the state. iCIMS was recognized by ROI Editor Tom Bergeron as an “example of how the state can create, nurture and grow a tech brand.”
Department of Defense
iCIMS’ Manager of Integration Services, Gina McCullough, received an award from the Department of Defense’s Employer Support of the Guard and Reserve (ESGR). Three representatives from the Monmouth County division of the ESGR visited iCIMS’ headquarters at Bell Works in Holmdel, NJ to present McCullough with the Patriot Award on February 27, 2018.
McCullough received the award for demonstrating outstanding support and commitment to one of her team members who is currently deployed to serve our nation. ESGR works with employers to support employees’ military service and to ensure that reservists and National Guard members can return to their jobs from active duty.
Earlier this year iCIMS was also named a finalist in NJBIZ’s Best Places to Work in NJ awards program for the seventh consecutive year.
Click here to learn more about other awards received by iCIMS.
About iCIMS, Inc.:
iCIMS is the leading provider of talent acquisition solutions that help businesses win the war for top talent. iCIMS empowers companies to manage their entire hiring process within the industry’s most robust Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS). Built on the foundation of a best-to-market talent acquisition software suite, iCIMS’ PaaS framework, UNIFi , allows employers to expand the capabilities of their core talent acquisition technology by integrating with the largest partner ecosystem in talent acquisition to help them attract, find, screen, and manage candidates. Offering scalable, easy-to-use solutions that are backed by award-winning customer service, iCIMS supports more than 3,500 contracted customers and is one of the largest and fastest-growing talent acquisition solution providers.
About the Stevie Awards
Stevie Awards are conferred in seven programs: the Asia-Pacific Stevie Awards, the German Stevie Awards, The American Business Awards, The International Business Awards®, the Stevie Awards for Great Employers, the Stevie Awards for Women in Business and the Stevie Awards for Sales & Customer Service. Stevie Awards competitions receive more than 10,000 entries each year from organizations in more than 60 nations. Honoring organizations of all types and sizes and the people behind them, the Stevies recognize outstanding performances in the workplace worldwide. Learn more about the Stevie Awards at www.StevieAwards.com .
About ROI-NJ
Created by Prospect Publishing Group and led by longtime industry leaders Tom Bergeron and Tom Hughes; ROI-NJ delivers real-time news and features that provide New Jersey’s diverse business community with a Return On Information, while creating dynamic engagements among influencers.
About the Department of Defense’s Employer Support of the Guard and Reserve
ESGR, a Department of Defense program, was established in 1972 to promote cooperation and understanding between Reserve Component Service members and their civilian employers and to assist in the resolution of conflicts arising from an employee's military commitment.
